content: For addressing issue #D208 on electron app, i.e. need of a back button, would like to know whether people use the back button in the Zulip webapp. If they do, we can integrate it in the desktop app as well.
cc @Tim Abbott @Akash Nimare
I use the back button frequently on webapp but for desktop, I mostly use keyboard shortcuts. @Matthias, @Grahame Grieve do you think we should add this button in the left sidebar?
I think in general a lot of people use the actual back button in their browsers.
I never miss the back button in the desktop app, and can't think of using ig in the web app, though I don't use that much. but why ask me?

I never miss the back button in the desktop app,

I feel the same. Asked you because you're one of the heavy user of the desktop app :)

So, in Zulip, the back (and forward) buttons are a useful form of navigation (will take you to the next/previous narrows). I use them occasionally, so I guess I'd like there to be a "back/forward" UI in the desktop app. But if it's something few people use, I can imagine having it be hidden behind an option by default or in a part of the UI that's lower-value.
Ah, I see this is an issue I filed last summer. :-)
I don't think it would make sense to add a back button that's hidden behind an option. Few users will find and turn on the option; it'd be easier to learn the keyboard shortcut.

Reading the context from today in that thread, motivating this question:

Yes, I absolutely use "the back button" all the time in the Zulip webapp. Always with a browser keyboard shortcut (Alt-left), not the physical button next to the location bar.
We've had the keyboard shortcut for a long time; just no UI for it (other than maybe something hidden in a menu)

I feel the usage of the back button is certainly more than the reload button in a session. If we can have a reload button, we can have a back button since the space for it is cheap.
Personally, as a user I use the physical back button more often than not.
same as Greg, I use Alt-left very often (web app).
I use alt-left and alt-right a lot, plus the browser buttons too when I am already in “mouse mode”.
OK, sounds like we should probably include back/forward buttons in the app (I think just back without forward would be suboptimal).
Sounds like a plan.

Three mockups:
Back/Forward Button in separate divs , Only back button , Back/Forward button closer .
Not much info in UI, so suggestions are most welcome!
I think the top is probably the best-looking; I wonder if there's a way to fit them side-by-side that doesn't look bad.
@Tim Abbott Something like this? side-by-side at top left
That looks a bit cluttered: maybe with some tweaking of size/spacing that could be OK.
This looks kinda messy. We can afford these buttons in the bottom only.
I think we should start with making the arrows smaller to make them look good, but I also suspect even after that's fixed, we'll end up wanting them to be at the bottom, next to reload.
Another mockup
@Akash Nimare Could you suggest other UI mockups?
experimental idea: how about having just the back one, and on hover it expands to show both back and forward?

Yeah, that would make sense. I had quite a few people getting stuck at the password reset or other page because they didn't know how to get back. The non-techy user doesn't know that an electron app is still more or less a browser.

sorry, my reply is to Akash mentioning me. I didn't see the rest as I had the stream muted.
I'm replying to the question whether I would see a reason for having those back and forward buttons.
I sorta like Rishi's idea; my main worry is whether that'd end up being annoying (because the thing you moved your mouse to click on moves)

@Abhigyan Khaund let's try rishi's idea, otherwise, this one looks good -
https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/9a/Nn4gRL41rahXYn2gDz06sld3/Screenshot-from-2018-02-13-01-47-38.png

^^ Let's go with this one, later on, we can make this section collapsible -
img
Hmm, yeah, that helps a lot with the clutter issue.
another option would be to only show the forward arrow when there is a thing to go forward to
Yeah, that'd be a fine option if the Electron featureset supports it.
also, in my first suggestion, I'm imagining the forward arrow would pop up above or to the side of the back arrow; so the back arrow would never move
@Rishi Gupta Were you suggesting something on this lline? above.gif side.gif

For now I'll work on (https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/9a/Nn4gRL41rahXYn2gDz06sld3/Screenshot-from-2018-02-13-01-47-38.png) as @Akash Nimare mentioned, then move on to making the section collapsible.

yup! With an appropriate animation.
For the first, I would also put more space between the two; i.e. the normal spacing between the icons. For the second, I would increase the height of the black box.
great
I don't think a 'Forward' button is needed. It is way less frequently used than the 'Back' and is not used on mobile, for example.
Agreed. Even on webapp I rarely use forward button.
@Akash Nimare So should I PR with the forward button as in https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/9a/Nn4gRL41rahXYn2gDz06sld3/Screenshot-from-2018-02-13-01-47-38.png or without a forward button?
Let's go with the Back button only.
I use the forward button occasionally with Zulip, but I think this is something where we can start with just back and see whether we get feedback asking for a forward button.
==Tim

I actually use "the forward button" quite regularly in my mobile browser, in general -- I know this because the fact that it's harder to get to has been one of my handful of main annoyances on switching from iOS to Android a month ago :stuck_out_tongue:
(On iOS, it's swipe left; on Chrome for Android, it's somewhere in the "overflow menu")
I wonder if the shortcuts for Back/Forward are still active in the desktop app?

@Boris Yankov yeah the shortcuts are there as it is.
pasted image
@Akash Nimare it sounds like there may be a bug making them not work right, though? Just saw the issue go by in the repo.
Hmm, which issue? Both the shortcuts are working as expected in master and the latest release.
https://github.com/zulip/zulip-electron/issues/416. Oh, I see, not actually back-button related.
(Was just skimming when I saw it go by in email; my misunderstanding)
